title: Operation / Admin Assistant Job at Maxitech Global Investment Limited
content:
Maxitech Global Investment Limited is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operation / Admin Assistant

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a reliable and organized Operations / Admin Assistant to support our daily administrative and operational tasks.
	The ideal candidate should be proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of multitasking in a fast-paced work environment.
	This role is critical in ensuring smooth office operations and assisting various departments as required.


Responsibilities


	Provide general administrative and operational support to the team
	Support logistics and inventory processes
	Coordinate internal communication and follow up on assigned tasks
	Handle errands, basic documentation, and assist with vendor-related matters
	Ensure timely delivery and proper documentation of operational tasks
	Perform any other duties as assigned by management


Requirements


	Maximum qualification of OND in any field
	1 year of relevant experience is an added advantage
	Strong communication and organizational skills
	Must be punctual, trustworthy, and willing to learn
	Must reside within or close to Ikeja, Lagos
	Male candidates are preferred for gender balance.
	Gender Preference: Male (for gender balance).


Salary
N60,000 – N70,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: olamilekan.sule@maxitechglobal.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Factory Staff Job at Ascentech Services Limited
content:
Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. We are committed to forging long-term partnerships with our clients by creating and delivering robust and flexible services that address the changing needs of their business.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Factory Staff
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Production

Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Factory Staff supports daily operations in a food manufacturing plant by operating machinery, ensuring product quality, maintaining cleanliness, and adhering to safety standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Operate and monitor machinery
	Handle raw materials and package finished goods
	Conduct quality checks and report defects
	Maintain clean, safe, and organized work areas
	Document production data and issues
	Collaborate with team members to meet production targets
	Participate in training and follow company policies.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Accurate weighing of raw and finished materials
	Meeting production targets
	Adhering to food safety and sanitation standards
	Effective packaging and labelling
	Daily participation in GMP-related activities (e.g., HACCP, sanitation)
	This role requires physical stamina, precision, and a strong focus on quality and safety in a team-based environment.


Requirements


	High school diploma or equivalent
	Experience in production/manufacturing preferred
	Ability to operate machinery and lift heavy items
	Strong attention to detail and teamwork skills
	Knowledge of food safety and hygiene (a plus).


Salary
N70,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruiter13@ascentech.com.ng using "Factory Staff" as the subject of the mail.

title: Chief Supply Chain Officer Job at Jumia
content:
Jumia is Africa's leading internet group, with already over 3,000 employees in more than 20 African countries and huge successes such as Jumia, Jumia Travel, Jumia Food, Jumia Deals, Jumia House, Jumia Jobs and Jumia Services. It is led by top talented leaders offering a great mix of local and international talents and is backed by MTN, Millicom, Rocket Internet, Axa, Orange, Goldman Sachs & CdC.

We are recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chief Supply Chain Officer - Pipeline

Job Location: Nigeria

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As CSCO, you will drive operational excellence across our integrated warehouse network, optimize logistics infrastructure, and support our path to profitability through efficient, scalable supply chain solutions adapted to African markets


What you will be doing
Operations Excellence and Service Quality:


	Implement best practice fulfillment, distribution, on-demand and delivery operations
	Drive business relationships with clients and prospects by exploring opportunities to sell the full portfolio of Jumia Services
	Manage quality of service being provided to all clients
	Constantly improve and develop new internal processes
	Make fast decisions to resolve emergencies
	Coordinate project management of all initiatives within your team
	Undertake ad-hoc projects as required in the development of the company objectives


Team Management and Leadership:


	Recruit and manage the sales, fulfillment and logistics team
	Scale the team and the processes to support the growth of the company
	Create an unparalleled environment for employee development and happiness
	Manage fleet operations and 3PL providers, including contract negotiations


Operational and Financial Performance:


	Deliver measurable results linked to your business within designated region
	Ensure regular reporting of the Operational performance, actions and results against targets
	Ensure the quality of the measurement of selected KPIs
	Manage and control Budget, including revenues and operational / capital expenditures
	Ensure that all financial processes associated with each financial month, quarter and year end are executed


Requirements


	12+ years of senior supply chain leadership experience, preferably in e-commerce or retail.
	Master's degree in Business Administration or Supply Chain Management preferred.
	Proven track record managing multi-country logistics operations, preferably in emerging markets
	Experience with warehouse operations, distribution networks, and third-party logistics management
	Strong background in supply chain technology, automation, and digital transformation
	Deep understanding of e-commerce fulfillment and last-mile delivery challenges
	Excellent analytical skills with ability to optimize complex logistics networks
	Experience with warehouse management systems (WMS) and logistics technology platforms
	Knowledge of supply chain analytics and performance management
	Understanding of inventory optimization and demand planning
	Strong leadership and change management capabilities
	Experience with cost optimization and operational efficiency initiatives
	Cultural sensitivity and understanding of African market dynamics
	Familiarity with third-party logistics marketplace models

title: Logistics Operations Manager Job at Jumia
content:
Jumia is Africa's leading internet group, with already over 3,000 employees in more than 20 African countries and huge successes such as Jumia, Jumia Travel, Jumia Food, Jumia Deals, Jumia House, Jumia Jobs and Jumia Services. It is led by top talented leaders offering a great mix of local and international talents and is backed by MTN, Millicom, Rocket Internet, Axa, Orange, Goldman Sachs & CdC.

We are recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics Operations Manager

Job Location: Nigeria

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Logistics Operations Manager will oversee material handling, transportation, delivery, and return collections.
	They will prepare worker schedules and ensure that distribution, delivery, and last-mile workers adhere to safety regulations.


What you will be doing


	Managing day to day operations.
	Challenging established processes and implementing new processes to adapt to the fast growth of Jumia Supply Chain clients.
	Finding creative and innovative ways to offer a better customer experience.
	Fully understanding our information system and working with our IT team to roll our new developments.
	Working closely with the Supply Chain central team to share and implement global best practices.
	Managing relationships with clients and partners (Third party logistics partners).
	Responsible for the logistics P&L.
	Responsible to meet the logistics targets and KPIs including quality of customer experience.


What we are looking for


	10 years with 2+ years direct management experience, preferably in a manufacturing, production or distribution environment with a strong focus on logistics or alternatively consulting / banking.
	A completed master’s degree from an accredited university; Degree in Engineering, Operations, Supply Chain or MBA preferred.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office – Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Email, Internet etc.
	Proficient in Google Office Suite – Google Drive, Google Sheets, Google Docs, Gmail, etc.
	Ability to lead large teams.
	Experience with process design and improvement.
	Experience with the full staffing lifecycle, including interviewing, hiring, performance management, promotions and terminations.
	Strong analytical skills.
	Pro-active attitude, entrepreneur, able to work both independently and within a team.
	Hardworking, result-oriented, methodical and very structured.
